intro: Gumira mariannarum, commonly known as the Mariana gumira, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom during the wet season. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
